paragraphs.content: LORD, I cry unto thee: make haste unto me; give ear unto my voice, when I cry unto thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lord, I cry unto thee: make haste unto me; give ear unto my voice, when I cry unto thee.

paragraphs.content: Let my prayer be set forth before thee as incense; and the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let my prayer be set forth before thee as incense; and the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.

paragraphs.content: Set a watch, O LORD, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Set a watch, O Lord, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips.

paragraphs.content: Incline not my heart to any evil thing, to practise wicked works with men that work iniquity: and let me not eat of their dainties.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Incline not my heart to any evil thing, to practise wicked works with men that work iniquity: and let me not eat of their dainties.

paragraphs.content: Let the righteous smite me; it shall be a kindness: and let him reprove me; it shall be an excellent oil, which shall not break my head: for yet my prayer also shall be in their calamities.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let the righteous smite me; it shall be a kindness: and let him reprove me; it shall be an excellent oil, which shall not break my head: for yet my prayer also shall be in their calamities.

paragraphs.content: When their judges are overthrown in stony places, they shall hear my words; for they are sweet.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When their judges are overthrown in stony places, they shall hear my words; for they are sweet.

paragraphs.content: Our bones are scattered at the grave’s mouth, as when one cutteth and cleaveth wood upon the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Our bones are scattered at the grave’s mouth, as when one cutteth and cleaveth wood upon the earth.

paragraphs.content: But mine eyes are unto thee, O GOD the Lord: in thee is my trust; leave not my soul destitute.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But mine eyes are unto thee, O God the Lord: in thee is my trust; leave not my soul destitute.

paragraphs.content: Keep me from the snares which they have laid for me, and the gins of the workers of iniquity.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Keep me from the snares which they have laid for me, and the gins of the workers of iniquity.

paragraphs.content: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, whilst that I withal escape.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, whilst that I withal escape.
